document_data.name: Native item
document_data.Effects:
In ages prior to the [[Spellplague]], magical items with "plus" enchantments – most commonly armors, weapons, and ''[[cloak of protection|cloaks]]'' or ''[[ring of protection|rings of protection]]'' – would lose some of their potency outside of their [[plane]] of origin,

When cast, ''native item'' artificially restored these levels of enchantment in an item,This side-effect is not mentioned in ''[[The Planewalker's Handbook]]''. The chance of this backlash of energy occurring cumulatively increased with each additional effected item that an individual wielded. Additionally, there existed a twenty-percent chance for each such item to disappear, returning to their plane of origin.

This spell took four minutes to cast and lasted for a minimum of ten minutes, with the duration cumulatively growing in increments of ten minutes depending upon how powerful the spellcaster was.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components, ''native item'' required the spellcaster to rub the desired magical item with a bit of soil or water from its plane of origin, or whatever was the closest equivalent to those substances therein.
document_data.History:
Sometime in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], a group of [[adventurer]]s from [[Ravens Bluff]] traveling in the [[Layers of the Abyss|144{{th}} Layer of the Abyss]] came across a race of [[human]]s known as the [[Verlassim]]. The leader of these people, Baron [[Tauris]], casted ''native item'' on one of the belongings of these adventurers in an elaborate ritual. This casting was so powerful that the spell's duration lasted for the remainder of their time in that Abyssal layer.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/A Ticket to Midnight|21}}

Some time later, a [[duergar]] sage living in [[Acheron]] by the name of [[Gheldoin]] gifted a [[spellbook]] containing ''native item'' to another group of Ravenian adventurers after they impressed him by deciphering the script on an old [[scroll]] that detailed a story about [[Laduguer]].<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/Stone and Steel|15,17}}
